references.paper_title: Neural injective functions for multisets, measures and graphs via a finite witness theorem
references.reason: This paper provides a theoretical foundation for understanding the expressive power of different aggregation functions in graph neural networks, which is central to the current work's contribution.

references.paper_title: Accurate learning of graph representations with graph multiset pooling
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel pooling mechanism for graph neural networks which improves the accuracy of graph representation learning.
This paper proposes a new architecture for graph neural networks that is based on equivariant subgraph aggregation, which improves the performance of the model on various tasks.

references.paper_title: Convolutional networks on graphs for learning molecular fingerprints
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the effectiveness of convolutional neural networks for learning molecular fingerprints, which are used in various downstream tasks related to molecular properties.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This seminal paper introduced graph convolutional networks, which are widely used in various graph-related tasks and form the basis of many subsequent models.
